p: The predomination of aliphatic acids, such as hexadecanoic acid, could explain the obtained powerful antimicrobial effect [ 24]. Moreover, oxygenated monoterpenoids like camphor and linalool were also described to be accountable for the antimicrobial activity of various essential oils [ 25, 26]. The possible synergistic actions of these components in the essential oil ought to be granted consideration. Our results are in a good agreement with studies of volatile oils and methanol extracts prepared from other Leucas members [ 8, 17, 22, 27].
